verses.verse: "Why aren't <S%H6256><s%> times laid up by <S%H6845><s%> the Almighty? <S%H7706><s%> Why don't <S%H3045><s%> those who know him see <S%H2372><s%> his days? <S%H3117><s%>
There are people who remove <S%H5381><s%> the landmarks. <S%H1367><s%> They violently take away <S%H1497><s%> flocks, <S%H5739><s%> and feed them. <S%H7462><s%>
They drive away <S%H5090><s%> the donkey <S%H2543><s%> of the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> and they take <S%H2254><s%> the widow <S%H490><s%>'s ox <S%H7794><s%> for a pledge. <S%H2254><s%>
They turn <S%H5186><s%> the needy <S%H34><s%> out of the way. <S%H1870><s%> The poor <S%H6041><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> all <S%H3162><s%> hide themselves. <S%H2244><s%>

Behold, <S%H6501><s%> as wild donkeys in the desert, <S%H4057><s%> they go forth <S%H3318><s%> to their work, <S%H6467><s%> seeking diligently <S%H7836><s%> for food. <S%H2964><s%> The wilderness <S%H6160><s%> yields them bread <S%H3899><s%> for their children. <S%H5288><s%>
They cut <S%H7114><s%> their provender <S%H1098><s%> in the field. <S%H7704><s%> They glean <S%H3953><s%> the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> of the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
They lie all night <S%H3885><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> without clothing, <S%H3830><s%> and have no covering <S%H3682><s%> in the cold. <S%H7135><s%>
They are wet <S%H7372><s%> with the showers <S%H2230><s%> of the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and embrace <S%H2263><s%> the rock <S%H6697><s%> for lack of a shelter. <S%H4268><s%>
There are those who pluck <S%H1497><s%> the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> from the breast, <S%H7699><s%> and take a pledge <S%H2254><s%> of the poor, <S%H6041><s%>
So that they go <S%H1980><s%> around naked <S%H6174><s%> without clothing. <S%H3830><s%> Being hungry, <S%H7457><s%> they carry <S%H5375><s%> the sheaves. <S%H6016><s%>
They make oil <S%H6671><s%> within <S%H996><s%> the walls <S%H7791><s%> of these men. <S%H1869><s%> They tread wine presses, <S%H3342><s%> and suffer thirst. <S%H6770><s%>

From out of the populous city, <S%H5892><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> groan. <S%H5008><s%> The soul <S%H5315><s%> of the wounded <S%H2491><s%> cries out, <S%H7768><s%> yet God <S%H433><s%> doesn't <S%H7760><s%> regard the folly. <S%H8604><s%>
"These are of those who rebel <S%H4775><s%> against the light. <S%H216><s%> They don't <S%H5234><s%> know its ways, <S%H1870><s%> nor stay <S%H3427><s%> in its paths. <S%H5410><s%>

The murderer <S%H7523><s%> rises <S%H6965><s%> with the light. <S%H216><s%> He kills <S%H6991><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy. <S%H6041><s%> In the night <S%H3915><s%> he is like a thief. <S%H1590><s%>

The eye <S%H5869><s%> also of the adulterer <S%H5003><s%> waits <S%H8104><s%> for the twilight, <S%H5399><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> <S%H5869><s%> 'No eye shall see <S%H7789><s%> me. <S%H5643><s%>' He disguises his face. <S%H6440><s%>

In the dark <S%H2822><s%> they dig through <S%H2864><s%> houses. <S%H1004><s%> They shut <S%H2856><s%> themselves up in the daytime. <S%H3119><s%> They don't <S%H3045><s%> know the light. <S%H216><s%>
For the morning <S%H1242><s%> is to all of them like <S%H3162><s%> thick darkness, <S%H6757><s%> for they know <S%H5234><s%> the terrors <S%H1091><s%> of the thick darkness. <S%H6757><s%>

"They are foam <S%H7031><s%> on the surface of the waters. <S%H6440><s%> Their portion <S%H2513><s%> is cursed <S%H7043><s%> in the earth. <S%H776><s%> They don't <S%H6437><s%> turn into the way <S%H1870><s%> of the vineyards. <S%H3754><s%>
Drought <S%H6723><s%> and heat <S%H2527><s%> consume <S%H1497><s%> the snow <S%H7950><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> so does Sheol <S%H7585><s%> those who have sinned. <S%H2398><s%>

The womb <S%H7358><s%> shall forget <S%H7911><s%> him. <S%H7415><s%> The worm shall feed sweetly <S%H4988><s%> on him. <S%H2142><s%> He shall be no more remembered. Unrighteousness <S%H5766><s%> shall be broken <S%H7665><s%> as a tree. <S%H6086><s%>
He devours <S%H7462><s%> the barren <S%H6135><s%> who don't <S%H3205><s%> bear. He shows no kindness <S%H3190><s%> to the widow. <S%H490><s%>
Yet God preserves <S%H4900><s%> the mighty <S%H47><s%> by his power. <S%H3581><s%> He rises up <S%H6965><s%> who has no assurance <S%H539><s%> of life. <S%H2416><s%>
God gives <S%H5414><s%> them security, <S%H983><s%> and they rest <S%H8172><s%> in it. <S%H5869><s%> His eyes are on their ways. <S%H1870><s%>

They are exalted; <S%H7426><s%> yet a little while, <S%H4592><s%> and they are gone. <S%H4355><s%> Yes, they are brought low, they are taken out <S%H7092><s%> of the way <S%H1870><s%> as all others, <S%H5243><s%> and are cut off as the tops <S%H7218><s%> of the ears of grain. <S%H7641><s%>
If it isn't <S%H645><s%> so now, who will prove <S%H7760><s%> me a liar, <S%H3576><s%> and make <S%H7760><s%> my speech <S%H4405><s%> worth nothing? <S%H408><s%>"
